subject: libpldm: Add encode API for RequestUpdate cmd request
commitMessage:
libpldm: Add encode API for RequestUpdate cmd request

RequestUpdate command is the command to initiate a firmware update
for a firmware device. This implementation works with DSP0267_1.1.0,
DSP0267_1.0.1 and DSP0267_1.0.0.

Tested: Unit tests passed

Signed-off-by: gokulsanker <gokul.sanker.v.g@intel.com>
Change-Id: Id74a65aa5975839c89ca433c16cfc67dcf4890c1

Change has been successfully rebased and submitted as d434edc60339679986268e1b8b82b7c432d1d206 by Tom Joseph
Is this a separate API for empty payload?
this is a genreic api to create pldm header
In the PLDM header the message type comes first, we can move this arg as the first one.
All the validation can happen first, before packing.
All the validation can happen first, before packing.
comp_image_set_ver_str_len can be checked if it same as comp_img_set_ver_str->length
There is no change in this file, you can remove it in the next patch.
nit: Check whether the string type is valid
nit: true if the string type is valid one
This validation can happen in the encode function, before doing htole* transactions.
not needed as per the comment in the .h
Please add this after the already defined constants.
Don't need a separate enumeration, add the update commands in the same enumeration.
Please add an enumeration for the PLDM firmware update completion codes. Table 1 in the specification.
nit: "String type values defined in the PLDM firmware update specification"
PLDM_STR_TYPE_* for all enums will be more apt.
const not needed for basic types
Passing the parameters as a struct is causing an extra copy with the fill function, pass the parameters to the encode function.
I will review the unit test code after the rework is complete with the implementation.
This can be removed, the below condition covers it better.
This condition not need, if msg is a valid pointer. This condition will also succeed.
Move this validation before packing the header
Move it after #define PLDM_GET_FIRMWARE_PARAMETERS_REQ_BYTES 0, just to keep all the constants related to a command together.
move all the [in] parameters after instance_id, keep msg and payload_length at the last
nit: blank lines before and after @return line
Define an example component version string(std::string) and pass it to the API.
I think it can be confusing, libpldm follows snake case, C++ code variables have lowerCamelCase(like maxTransferSize). All these variables can be defined as constexpr.
use ascii when using std::string for the component version string
Not needed if using a std::string
uint8_t, there was a recent patch that made this change that got merged.
